results.title: The Killing of Angelo Tsakos
results.brief_description: In 1985, Angelo Tsakos, a young Greek-Australian boy from the depressed western suburbs of Sydney was shot dead while driving a stolen car, by a probationary police constable. He was only sixteen. At the inquiry into the incident, three differing versions of the event were described. This film reconstructs these versions and finds questions still unanswered. His family continue in their efforts to get a full enquiry into the killing of Angelo Tsakos.

results.title: The Killifish
results.brief_description: A study of the life cycle of the killifish, showing it in streams and ponds, but principally in aquariums. The physical conditions and feed requirements are explained. Egglaying, and the development of the young fish are shown. Uses Photomicroscopy. English commentary, Japanese subtitles.

results.title: The Kidney: the living machine
results.creator_credit: John Rodgers and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Peter Couchman discusses the function of the human kidney with Professor Graeme Campbell of the Melbourne Zoological Department. Discusses kidney malfunction and how this can be treated by dialysis together with footage of patients undergoing treatment at Prince Henry’s Hospital.

results.title: The Kid
results.brief_description: The Kid - Dumped in a garbage can, in the roughest part of the slums, a vagabond tramp finds an abandoned baby. No-one in the slums can afford another mouth to feed, but with the ever-watchful policeman around the corner, the tramp is unwittingly compelled to “adopt” the child. In classic style resembling the later “Gold Rush”, Chaplin shows his genius in bringing up baby, from inventing his own hysterical methods of changing nappies, to teaching the grown-up nine year old the art of survival, of self-defence, and earning a living- the Kid smashes windows, while Charlie repairs them cheap! A heart-warming story also unfolds, as the true mother stumbles upon her child - Coogan’s sensational performance made him the best-loved child star of the Golden Era! Cast also includes Edna Purviance, Chuck Riesner, Carl Miller, Henry Bergman. “Three men in a tub” - Alfalfa loses his girl to a smoothie with a yacht, but conspires with his friends to get her back. Featuring the Little Rascals.

results.title: The Keeping of the green
results.creator_credit: Joe O'Brien and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
As the population density of cities increases there is greater pressure to devote existing green areas to profitable industrial and residential uses. This film examines the need for green areas in cities - for recreation, for beauty and for relieving the effects of urban crowding.

results.title: The Kauri
results.creator_credit: Derek Wright, New Zealand National Film Unit and Conon Fraser
results.brief_description: Outlines the destruction done to the New Zealand Kauri forests at the end of the century. The forests were plundered for the wood, the highly profitable resinous gum and the land. Due to careful replanting programs and selective tree felling, the forests are now slowly increasing and there are strong hopes of a future for the giant Kauri tree.

results.title: The Karri forest
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson, Australian National Film Board and Antonio Colacino
results.brief_description: A tall karri forest in south-west of Western Australia is part of the State’s third of a million acres of forest. It provides a continuous and increasing supply for the timber industry; and is the site of a youth camp for school children. Forest officers explain various aspects of forestry to the children showing felling, milling and fire control. Other attractions include rare wildflowers, reptiles and birds.

results.title: The Kandy Perahera
results.brief_description: The Perahera that takes place in Sri Lanka, is one of the most magnificent torchlight pageants in the world. Known as the Festival of the August Moon, the Kandy Perahera is held annually in the lunar month of Esala (July/August) in the hill capital of Kandy, stronghold of the proud Sinhala Kings for over 20 centuries, and Sri Lanka’s most beautiful city. This video captures an impression of the visual splendour and exciting atmosphere of a pageant that includes up to 1200 elephants with an animated cast of thousands.
